greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of zeta'(-1, 1/2).
link: J. Miller and V. Adamchik, Derivatives of the Hurwitz Zeta Function for Rational Arguments, Journal of Computational and Applied Mathematics 100 (1998) 201-206. [contains a large number of typos]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Hurwitz Zeta Function, formula 22.
formula: Equals -1/24 - log(2)/24 + log(A)/2, where A is the Glaisher-Kinkelin constant A074962.
Equals (log(Pi) - 1 + gamma)/24 - Zeta'(2)/(4*Pi^2), where gamma is the Euler-Mascheroni constant A001620.
results.author: _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 23 2019
